intro: Styphelia melaleucoides, commonly known as the white-stemmed winterbloom, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and other ericaceous plants. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers during the autumn and winter months, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are typically covered in a fine, white tomentum. Styphelia melaleucoides thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal heaths.
